Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0617 b) Date of Occurrence: 25/04/2024
c) Installation Details: Medusa Strike - AC-9639-675 at
Maintenance Hub-X
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 03/05/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Fuel Injection d) Main Assembly: Wing Root Port
e) Nomenclature: Fuel Injection Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-D
g) Part No.: PR-6105-U1 h) Sl No.: SN-3235-411
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 16/12/2020 l) Date of Removal: 30/04/2024
Pg No: 31 Ln No: 1 Pg No: 92 Ln No: 16
m) Manufacturing Agency: Gamma Defense Manufacturing n) Date, Month & Year January 2016
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2978 Hrs / 859 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Thrust reverser deployment delay. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Improper calibration during last maintenance cycle
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fuel Injection component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin
d) Attributable Code: F - Failure/ageing/Corrosion/Material Failure
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 12/05/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings.
Date: 15/05/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 14/05/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 19/05/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 21/05/2024 Signature: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
